required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of the Efficacy of Rhomboid Intercostal Block and Erector Spinal Plane Block on Myofascial Pain Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of the Efficacy of Ultrasound Guided Rhomboid Intercostal Block and Erector Spinal Plane Block on Lower Cervical and Interscapular Myofascial Pain Syndrome

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators evaluate the effect of Ultrasound guided Rhomboid Intercostal Block and Erector Spinal Plane Block on lower cervical and inter scapular Myofascial Pain

detailed_description.textblock: Myofascial pain syndrome (MPS) is the most common cause of musculoskeletal pain and its prevalence in the population is reported to be 21-30%. In this study, the investigators compare the effect of two regional anesthesia block techniques with the ultrasound guidance.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to minutes 30, day 1, week 1, 2, 4, 6 after the block
primary_outcome.description: Pain Score Change The 11-point NRS consists of numbers between 0 and 10 where 0 indicates "no pain" and 10 indicates "maximum pain." The patient is instructed to identify one number between 0 and 10, which is best representative of their pain intensity.

arm_group.description: Ultrasound guided erector spinae plane block

intervention.description: two regional anesthesia block techniques are applied

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Complaint of myofascial pain
- Pain that is rated at least 3 on a numerical rating scale (NRS, 0 = no pain, 10 = the worst pain)
Exclusion Criteria:
- pregnancy
- presence of coagulopathy, or the use of anticoagulants
- a history of surgery on the block area
- allergic to bupivacaine
- decline to participate

facility.name: Diskapi Yildirim Beyazit Training and Research Hospital
